intro: Brassia lanceana var. macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a sympodial orchid characterized by its upright growth habit and fleshy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, often arranged in racemose inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright indirect light and requires well-draining potting media. This variety is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
